{{About|the women's football (soccer) team|the men's football (soccer) club|Olympique Lyonnais}} {{Football club infobox |clubname = Olympique Lyonnais |image = |fullname = Olympique Lyonnais FÃ©minin |nickname = ''OL Ladies, Les Fenottes'' |founded = [[1970 in association football|1970]] as [[FC Lyon]]
[[2004 in association football|2004]] as [[Olympique Lyonnais]] |ground = Plaine des Jeux de [[Stade de Gerland|Gerland]]
[[Lyon]] |capacity = 2,500 |chrtitle = President |chairman = [[Paul Piemontese]] |manager = [[Patrice Lair]] |league = [[Division 1 FÃ©minine|D1 FÃ©minine]] |season = [[2010â11 Division 1 FÃ©minine|2010â11]] |position = 1st, D1 FÃ©minine | pattern_la1 =_shoulder stripes blue stripes half | pattern_b1 =_lyonh2010 | pattern_ra1 =_shoulder stripes blue stripes half | pattern_sh1 =_blue_stripes_adidas | pattern_so1 =_3_stripes_blue | leftarm1 = FFFFFF | body1 = FFFFFF | rightarm1 = FFFFFF | shorts1 = FFFFFF | socks1 = FFFFFF | pattern_la2=_lyon1011a | pattern_b2=_lyona2010 | pattern_ra2=_lyon1011a | pattern_sh2=_lyon1011a | pattern_so2=_lyon1011a | leftarm2 = 800040 | body2 = 800040 | rightarm2 = 800040 | shorts2 = 800040 | socks2 = 800040 | pattern_b3 = _lyon32010 | pattern_la3 = _lyon1011t | pattern_ra3 = _lyon1011t | pattern_sh3 = _adidaswhite | pattern_so3 = _3_stripes_white | leftarm3 = 000040 | body3 = 000040 | rightarm3 = 000040 | shorts3 = 000040 | socks3 = 000040 }} '''Olympique Lyonnais FÃ©minin''' ({{IPA-fr|ÉlÉÌpik ljÉnÉ}}; commonly referred to as '''Olympique Lyon''', '''Lyon''', or simply '''OL''') is a [[France|French]] women's [[football (soccer)|football]] club based in [[Lyon]]. The club has been the female section of [[Olympique Lyonnais]] since 2004. Lyon currently play in the [[Division 1 FÃ©minine]] and are the [[2009â10 Division 1 FÃ©minine|defending champions]] having won the league for five straight seasons.{{cite news |title=Lyon pip Juvisy to French title |url=http://www.uefa.com/womenschampionsleague/news/newsid=1497798.html |work=UEFA |publisher=UEFA |date=14 June 2010|accessdate=15 June 2010 }} The club was formed as the women's section of [[FC Lyon]] in 1970. In 2004, the women's club became the women's section of Olympique Lyonnais. Since joining Lyon, the women's section has won the Division 1 FÃ©minine five times and three [[Challenge de France]] titles. Lyon reached the semi-finals of the [[2007â08 UEFA Women's Cup|2007â08]] edition of the [[UEFA Women's Cup]] and, during the [[2009â10 in French football|2009â10 season]], reached [[2009â10 UEFA Women's Champions League#Final|the final]] of the inaugural edition of the [[UEFA Women's Champions League]] losing to [[Germany|German]] club [[FFC Turbine Potsdam|Turbine Potsdam]] 7â6 on penalties.{{cite news |title=Lyon and Potsdam make history |url=http://www.uefa.com/womenschampionsleague/news/newsid=1486723.html |work=UEFA |publisher=UEFA |date=11 May 2010|accessdate=16 June 2010 }}{{cite news |title=Potsdam hold nerve to claim European crown |url=http://www.uefa.com/womenschampionsleague/matches/season=2010/round=2000062/match=2001503/report/index.html |work=UEFA |publisher=UEFA |date=20 May 2010|accessdate=16 June 2010 }} In the following season, Lyon finally captured the UEFA Women's Champions League defeating its nemesis Turbine Potsdam 2â0 in the 2011 final. Lyon hosts its matches at the Plaine des Jeux de [[Stade de Gerland|Gerland]], a 2,500-capacity stadium that is situated not far from the [[Stade de Gerland]], where the male sections plays. The women's team does host its "big" matches at the 41,044-seat stadium. The president of the club is Paul Piemontese and the captain of the team is [[France women's national football team|French international]] [[Laura Georges]]. According to the [[UEFA coefficient|UEFA women's coefficient]], Lyon are the best club in [[UEFA]].{{cite news |title=UEFA WOMEN'S CHAMPIONS LEAGUE 2011/12 |url=http://www.uefa.com/MultimediaFiles/Download/competitions/General/01/64/33/58/1643358_DOWNLOAD.pdf |work=UEFA |publisher=UEFA |date=15 June 2011|accessdate=05 August 2011 }} ==Players==
